subject: Power Trading Master Agreements  July 20, Houston

Introduction


Assessment of skills
Areas of Interest

Overview of Power Trading

Statutory Framework for Power
Physical versus Financial Trading
Segmentation of Power Markets

Edison Electricity Institute

Scope and Breath of EEI
EEI and Energy
Commodity Definitions

EEI Master Power Purchase & Sale 
          Agreement

EEI

Review Section by Section

Review of Concepts
Bankruptcy Issues

Strengths and Weaknesses
Differences between the forms

Also includes complete coverage of the 
          impact of the Bankruptcy Abuse Prevention & Consumer Protection Act of 
          2005 on energy trading and energy trading contracts!
 






Anyone who 
      currently works with the EEI Master including:

Attorneys and Paralegals
Credit Professionals
Contract Administrators
Schedulers
Regulatory Professionals
VPs, Directors, Managers, Supervisors 
        in marketing, finance, credit and legal
 







Mark E. Haedicke -
      Principal - Haedicke Hoyt
Energy Consulting Services LLC
Mr. Haedicke has worked in the energy 
      business for more than 25 years. He has worked with gas and power 
      distribution companies, gas pipelines, commodity trading and marketing 
      companies and in power plant development. He also was the only non-Wall 
      Street representative on the Board of Directors of the International Swap 
      and Derivatives Association (ISDA) for six years.
